title: MARTIN KEOWN: Jurgen Klopp should take heart from taking a point from Old Trafford
text:
Liverpool need to learn to enjoy the situation they are in. Yes, every man and his dog may be prematurely putting a crown on your heads, but you have to embrace that.

Relish the pedestal you’re being put on. Liverpool lacked that mentality yesterday. They did not turn up at Old Trafford looking like a team that had won their last 17 Premier League games. They didn’t swagger in there like champions in waiting.

As soon as the half-time whistle went, Jurgen Klopp sprinted down the touchline and disappeared into the tunnel. He wanted to get to his players as quickly as possible and bring the team back together.

Manchester United frustrated Trent Alexander-Arnold and Co during their league draw

Jurgen Klopp will be disappointed but should take heart from fighting back for a point

All this was partly Liverpool’s own doing, but we also have to credit Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s Manchester United. Their tactics confused and surprised the visitors.

Solskjaer used three at the back and, especially in the first half, his wing-backs played high and did not drop as much as Liverpool would have expected.

United’s set-up meant they could apply good pressure on the ball all over the pitch, before they made it more of a stop-start match in the second half.

Liverpool should relish the pedestal they have been put on as Premier League leaders

It took Liverpool a while to sort themselves out but Klopp used his substitutes well and they got something out of this game. That at least suggests they can become champions.

Earlier on, they did not look like arriving as top dogs brought them any enjoyment, and that has to change.
